result.execSummary:
The defendant Cecil James Faust was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>1-5g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)1r.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: any other sentence now serving

superMiscConds.notes: DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Absolute sobriety
Any treatment/counseling as deemed necessary

records.addlTxt: ORDER FOR RETURN OF DEFENDANT'S SEIZED PERSONAL PROPERTY

1: 14 PM Defendant Cecil James Faust appeared by video, in custody at Fox Lake Correctional.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald appeared by video for Cecil James Faust.  Prosecuting attorney Anne Theresa Nack in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty to count 1. Court finds defendant guilty to count 1. Count 2 dismissed and read in. Defendant waives his right to a presentence investigation. Court orders 3 year prison and 3 years extended supervision, costs DOC collect, absolute sobriety, any treatment deemed necessary and money seized to be returned. Eligible for programs. Sentence credit 43 days.
